text.section:
In this section, "public seal" means:
the great seal of the State;
the seal of any court of the State; or
any other public seal of the State.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment for not less than 2 years and not exceeding 10 years.
A person who violates this section is subject to § 5-106(b) of the Courts Article.
